title: Grades 9-12: Special Topics in Language and Culture
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

B2270352FFB14EA1AF06F16BF3C853FC.description: describe how cultural awareness impacts personal growth.

4032B9DBEE2E465B9609E9CCAE4413F1.description: research careers in which cross-cultural awareness or LOTE language skills are needed; and

1847040233F64C7C93A7F789BD694878.description: participate in cultural events in local, global, or online communities and discuss experiences and perspectives gained;

4B7E1F7CB3B3493C87123C1E62184EDB.description: Communities. The student gains an understanding of cultures represented by LOTE to enhance global perspective, personal growth, and enrichment. The student is expected to:

0918FB47C69D411B820DCF28254FB32A.description: demonstrate how media such as television, Internet, newspapers, and advertisements represent selected cultural similarities and differences.

A18B8EAF2B1F420B8BB19A26DB996DE2.description: give examples of cognates, false cognates, idiomatic expressions, or sentence structure to show understanding of how languages are alike and different; and

71FE7B4F10EC4861873347DB10BB7A6A.description: compare and contrast selected cultural practices and perspectives such as traditions, daily life, and celebrations to student's own culture;

CA59349CCA794F57B31ED87A02C11D40.description: Comparisons. The student develops insight into the nature of the target language and culture by comparing the student's own language and culture to another. The student is expected to:

46C435FA98034DC8A96B46D7DE34F9A8.description: research and present information on historical and contemporary cultural influences.

87D70D6414C14CF19A5141EE2695F164.description: use authentic materials such as maps, graphs, graphic organizers, and other print and visual materials or literature to reinforce comprehension and expression of basic vocabulary in the target language; and

64B6BE648FB04120A4AFBD07DAD96F0A.description: Connections. The student describes connections between world languages and other disciplines. The student is expected to:

2C67A6E47FB4429EAC3A52FE550A6E78.description: describe various products across cultures such as food, shelter, clothing, transportation, sports and recreation, music, art, and dance.

674422EC1E5F4240986222B396F073A0.description: examine significant historic and contemporary influences from the cultures studied such as explorers, artists, musicians, and athletes; and

C919DA188EDE4AB8A1234F61F31D75F8.description: identify and describe selected cultural practices and perspectives such as traditions, daily life, and celebrations;

D32A77A2419D4C14961F4B2F88E9A5E6.description: Cultures. The student identifies the practices, products, and perspectives of selected cultures. The student is expected to:

5C84F4F17DEE442DA2660A93E9E552E9.description: exchange essential information about self, family, and familiar topics.

C7C1F777547F460FBB903C23E940ACD4.description: ask simple questions and provide simple responses related to personal preferences; and

A4FE9765FA4B4605B7180FD600B61BF6.description: introduce self and others using basic, culturally-appropriate greetings;

FFA52830913E42CDB51D3225E381E607.description: Communication. The student communicates an understanding of the elements of languages. The student is expected to:

29134534E89D46419BC5918E8979AB34.description: Special Topics in Language and Culture
